conclusion: The task is to analyze the positions and interactions of objects A, B, C, D, E, and F, particularly focusing on how gravity affects their movement and contact.

The image shows two sets of objects. On the left, there is a checkered object labeled A and a red object labeled D. On the right, there is a green object labeled F and a beige object labeled E. These objects are positioned on a table.
Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the locations of objects C, D, E, and F.
Object A is on the left side, and objects C and D are positioned to its right.
Object B is on the right side, and objects E and F are positioned to its left.
Objects C and D are adjacent to object A.
Objects E and F are adjacent to object B.
Due to gravity, objects A and B will fall and rest at the positions of objects C, D, E, and F.
Objects C, D, and F are the ones that come into contact with objects A and B, respectively.
